intro: Thysanachne, commonly known as the narrowleaf watergrass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance and is often found in wetland environments. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, clustered spikelets. Thysanachne species are adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats, often growing in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and marshes. These plants play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
